title: Don't (ab)use `TyKind::Error` when not planning to emit error

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
cc https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/70551 @eddyb 

Currently, it appears we are misusing `TyKind::Error` (and `Const::Error`) in these places, which we should refactor:

- [x] fixed by #70870 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/6dee5f1126dfd5c9314ee5ae9d9eb010e35ef257/src/librustc_typeck/check/wfcheck.rs#L710

- [x] fixed by #70870 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/6dee5f1126dfd5c9314ee5ae9d9eb010e35ef257/src/librustc_typeck/check/wfcheck.rs#L715

- [x] fixed by #70870 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/6dee5f1126dfd5c9314ee5ae9d9eb010e35ef257/src/librustc_typeck/lib.rs#L383

- [x] fixed by #70870 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/6dee5f1126dfd5c9314ee5ae9d9eb010e35ef257/src/librustc_typeck/variance/constraints.rs#L319

- [x] fixed by #70932 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/42abbd8878d3b67238f3611b0587c704ba94f39c/src/librustc_typeck/check/pat.rs#L1428-L1435

- [x] fixed by #71938 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/93dc97a85381cc52eb872d27e50e4d518926a27c/src/librustc_typeck/check/closure.rs#L180

- [x] fixed by #70164
    
    https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/6dee5f1126dfd5c9314ee5ae9d9eb010e35ef257/src/librustc_trait_selection/traits/select.rs#L3079

- [x] fixed by #71930 https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/9fed36055070168e5238d6bf6e58a36f519fe427/src/librustc_mir_build/hair/pattern/_match.rs#L900
